alert.note: Alert for Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Frank Church Wilderness; Lost River Range; Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Sun Valley Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 20 at 1:59PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times above 7000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches below 7000 feet and upwards of 10 inches above 7000 feet and across ridge tops and mountain passes. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central mountains above 7000 feet, impacting primarily Galena Summit and to a lesser extent the Stanley Basin. * WHEN...From Friday evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times, especially over mountain passes where blowing snow is possible. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Backcountry enthusiasts and hunters should be prepared for wintry conditions and the potential for hypothermia if caught in a storm unprepared.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
